verses.verse: ( The Parable of the Ten Virgins) Τότε <WG5119> Tote [“] At that time ὁμοιωθήσεται <WG3666> homoiōthēsetai will be like ἡ <WG3588> hē the βασιλεία <WG932> basileia kingdom τῶν <WG3588> tōn of οὐρανῶν <WG3772> ouranōn heaven δέκα <WG1176> deka ten παρθένοις <WG3933> parthenois virgins αἵτινες <WG3748> haitines who λαβοῦσαι <WG2983> labousai took τὰς <WG3588> tas - λαμπάδας <WG2985> lampadas lamps ἑαυτῶν <WG1438> heautōn their ἐξῆλθον <WG1831> exēlthon [and] went out εἰς <WG1519> eis to ὑπάντησιν <WG5222> hypantēsin meet τοῦ <WG3588> tou the νυμφίου <WG3566> nymphiou bridegroom .

πέντε <WG4002> pente Five δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐξ <WG1537> ex of αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan were μωραὶ <WG3474> mōrai foolish , καὶ <WG2532> kai and πέντε <WG4002> pente five [were] φρόνιμοι <WG5429> phronimoi wise .

αἱ <WG3588> hai The γὰρ <WG1063> gar - μωραὶ <WG3474> mōrai foolish [ones] λαβοῦσαι <WG2983> labousai took τὰς <WG3588> tas - λαμπάδας <WG2985> lampadas lamps ‹αὐτῶν› <WG846> autōn their οὐκ <WG3756> ouk [any extra] ἔλαβον <WG2983> elabon [but did not] take along μεθ’ <WG3326> meth’ . . . ἑαυτῶν <WG1438> heautōn . . . ἔλαιον <WG1637> elaion oil .

αἱ <WG3588> hai the δὲ <WG1161> de But φρόνιμοι <WG5429> phronimoi wise [ones] ἔλαβον <WG2983> elabon took ἔλαιον <WG1637> elaion oil ἐν <WG1722> en in τοῖς <WG3588> tois - ἀγγείοις <WG30> angeiois flasks μετὰ <WG3326> meta along with τῶν <WG3588> tōn - λαμπάδων <WG2985> lampadōn lamps . ἑαυτῶν <WG1438> heautōn their

χρονίζοντος <WG5549> chronizontos was delayed , δὲ <WG1161> de [When] τοῦ <WG3588> tou the νυμφίου <WG3566> nymphiou bridegroom ἐνύσταξαν <WG3573> enystaxan they all became drowsy πᾶσαι <WG3956> pasai vvv καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐκάθευδον <WG2518> ekatheudon fell asleep .

Μέσης <WG3319> Mesēs At midnight δὲ <WG1161> de - νυκτὸς <WG3571> nyktos . . . κραυγὴ <WG2906> kraugē the cry γέγονεν <WG1096> gegonen rang out : Ἰδοὺ <WG2400> Idou ‘ Here is ὁ <WG3588> ho the νυμφίος <WG3566> nymphios bridegroom ! ἐξέρχεσθε <WG1831> exerchesthe Come out εἰς <WG1519> eis to ἀπάντησιν <WG529> apantēsin meet ‹αὐτοῦ› <WG846> autou him ! ’

Τότε <WG5119> Tote Then ἠγέρθησαν <WG1453> ēgerthēsan woke up πᾶσαι <WG3956> pasai all αἱ <WG3588> hai the παρθένοι <WG3933> parthenoi virgins ἐκεῖναι <WG1565> ekeinai - καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐκόσμησαν <WG2885> ekosmēsan trimmed τὰς <WG3588> tas - λαμπάδας <WG2985> lampadas lamps . ἑαυτῶν <WG1438> heautōn their

αἱ <WG3588> hai The δὲ <WG1161> de - μωραὶ <WG3474> mōrai foolish ones ταῖς <WG3588> tais to the φρονίμοις <WG5429> phronimois wise , εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan said Δότε <WG1325> Dote ‘ Give ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin us ἐκ <WG1537> ek some of τοῦ <WG3588> tou - ἐλαίου <WG1637> elaiou oil ; ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - αἱ <WG3588> hai - λαμπάδες <WG2985> lampades lamps ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn our σβέννυνται <WG4570> sbennyntai are going out . ’

Ἀπεκρίθησαν <WG611> Apekrithēsan said δὲ <WG1161> de - αἱ <WG3588> hai the φρόνιμοι <WG5429> phronimoi wise [ones] λέγουσαι <WG3004> legousai . . . , Μή¦Ποτε <WG3379> Mē¦Pote ‘ or οὐ <WG3756> ou ‘ No , ’ μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv ἀρκέσῃ <WG714> arkesē there may not be enough ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin for [both] us καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you . πορεύεσθε <WG4198> poreuesthe go μᾶλλον <WG3123> mallon Instead , πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous those who πωλοῦντας <WG4453> pōlountas sell [oil] καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀγοράσατε <WG59> agorasate buy [some] ἑαυταῖς <WG1438> heautais for yourselves . ’

Ἀπερχομένων <WG565> Aperchomenōn were on their way δὲ <WG1161> de But αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn [while] they ἀγοράσαι <WG59> agorasai to buy [it] , ἦλθεν <WG2064> ēlthen arrived . ὁ <WG3588> ho the νυμφίος <WG3566> nymphios bridegroom καὶ <WG2532> kai - αἱ <WG3588> hai Those who ἕτοιμοι <WG2092> hetoimoi were ready εἰσῆλθον <WG1525> eisēlthon went in μετ’ <WG3326> met’ with αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou him εἰς <WG1519> eis to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γάμους <WG1062> gamous wedding banquet , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐκλείσθη <WG2808> ekleisthē was shut . ἡ <WG3588> hē the θύρα <WG2374> thyra door

Ὕστερον <WG5305> Hysteron Later δὲ <WG1161> de vvv ἔρχονται <WG2064> erchontai arrived καὶ <WG2532> kai and αἱ <WG3588> hai the λοιπαὶ <WG3062> loipai other παρθένοι <WG3933> parthenoi virgins λέγουσαι <WG3004> legousai said , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie ‘ Lord , κύριε <WG2962> kyrie lord , ἄνοιξον <WG455> anoixon open [the door] ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin for us ! ’

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis he replied εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen . . . , Ἀμὴν <WG281> Amēn ‘ Truly λέγω <WG3004> legō I tell ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you , οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv οἶδα <WG1492> oida I do not know ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas you . ’

Γρηγορεῖτε <WG1127> Grēgoreite keep watch , οὖν <WG3767> oun Therefore ὅτι <WG3754> hoti because οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv οἴδατε <WG1492> oidate you do not know τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran day οὐδὲ <WG3761> oude [or] τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὥραν <WG5610> hōran hour . ( BYZ and TR include when the Son of Man comes.)

Ὥσπερ <WG5618> Hōsper [it] is just like ( The Parable of the Talents) γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos a man ἀποδημῶν <WG589> apodēmōn going on a journey , ἐκάλεσεν <WG2564> ekalesen who called τοὺς <WG3588> tous - ἰδίους <WG2398> idious his δούλους <WG1401> doulous servants καὶ <WG2532> kai and παρέδωκεν <WG3860> paredōken entrusted αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them τὰ <WG3588> ta - ὑπάρχοντα <WG5225> hyparchonta possessions . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou with his

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ᾧ <WG3739> hō To one μὲν <WG3303> men - ἔδωκεν <WG1325> edōken he gave πέντε <WG4002> pente five τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta talents , ( A talent was worth about twenty years’ wages for a laborer.) ᾧ <WG3739> hō to [another] δὲ <WG1161> de - δύο <WG1417> dyo two [talents] , ᾧ <WG3739> hō to [another] δὲ <WG1161> de and ἕν <WG1520> hen one [talent] — ἑκάστῳ <WG1538> hekastō each κατὰ <WG2596> kata according to τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἰδίαν <WG2398> idian his own δύναμιν <WG1411> dynamin ability . καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἀπεδήμησεν <WG589> apedēmēsen he went on his journey .

Εὐθέως <WG2112> Eutheōs at once Πορευθεὶς <WG4198> Poreutheis went ὁ <WG3588> ho The [servant] τὰ <WG3588> ta the πέντε <WG4002> pente five τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta talents λαβὼν <WG2983> labōn who had received ἠργάσατο <WG2038> ērgasato [and] put them to work ( Or 15... And he went on his journey at once. 16... went and put them to work. Translators vary as to the placement of the Greek adverb eutheōs (at once) at the end of verse 15 or at the beginning of verse 16.) ἐν <WG1722> en . . . αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐκέρδησεν <WG2770> ekerdēsen gained ἄλλα <WG243> alla more . πέντε <WG4002> pente five
ὡσαύτως <WG5615> hōsautōs Likewise , ὁ <WG3588> ho the [one with] τὰ <WG3588> ta the δύο <WG1417> dyo two [talents] ἐκέρδησεν <WG2770> ekerdēsen gained ἄλλα <WG243> alla more . δύο <WG1417> dyo two

ὁ <WG3588> ho the [servant] δὲ <WG1161> de But τὸ <WG3588> to the ἓν <WG1520> hen one [talent] λαβὼν <WG2983> labōn who had received ἀπελθὼν <WG565> apelthōn went off , ὤρυξεν <WG3736> ōryxen dug a hole γῆν <WG1093> gēn in the ground , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἔκρυψεν <WG2928> ekrypsen hid τὸ <WG3588> to - ἀργύριον <WG694> argyrion money . τοῦ <WG3588> tou - κυρίου <WG2962> kyriou master’s αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

Μετὰ <WG3326> Meta After δὲ <WG1161> de vvv πολὺν <WG4183> polyn a long χρόνον <WG5550> chronon time ἔρχεται <WG2064> erchetai returned ὁ <WG3588> ho the κύριος <WG2962> kyrios master τῶν <WG3588> tōn - δούλων <WG1401> doulōn servants ἐκείνων <WG1565> ekeinōn of those καὶ <WG2532> kai - συναίρει <WG4868> synairei to settle λόγον <WG3056> logon accounts μετ’ <WG3326> met’ with αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - προσελθὼν <WG4334> proselthōn came ὁ <WG3588> ho The [servant] τὰ <WG3588> ta the πέντε <WG4002> pente five τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta talents λαβὼν <WG2983> labōn who had received προσήνεγκεν <WG4374> prosēnenken [and] presented ἄλλα <WG243> alla more πέντε <WG4002> pente five τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta - . λέγων <WG3004> legōn he said , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie ‘ Master , ’ πέντε <WG4002> pente with five τάλαντά <WG5007> talanta talents . μοι <WG1473> moi me παρέδωκας <WG3860> paredōkas ‘ you entrusted ἴδε <WG2400> ide See , ἄλλα <WG243> alla more . ’ πέντε <WG4002> pente five τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta - ἐκέρδησα <WG2770> ekerdēsa I have gained

Ἔφη <WG5346> Ephē replied αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - , ὁ <WG3588> ho - κύριος <WG2962> kyrios master αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His Εὖ <WG2095> Eu ‘ Well done , δοῦλε <WG1401> doule servant ! ἀγαθὲ <WG18> agathe good καὶ <WG2532> kai and πιστέ <WG4103> piste faithful ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi with ὀλίγα <WG3641> oliga a few things ; ἦς <WG1510> ēs You have been πιστός <WG4103> pistos faithful ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi of πολλῶν <WG4183> pollōn many things . σε <WG4771> se you in charge καταστήσω <WG2525> katastēsō I will put εἴσελθε <WG1525> eiselthe Enter εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὴν <WG3588> tēn the χαρὰν <WG5479> charan joy τοῦ <WG3588> tou of κυρίου <WG2962> kyriou master ! ’ σου <WG4771> sou your

Προσελθὼν <WG4334> Proselthōn came ‹δὲ› <WG1161> de - καὶ <WG2532> kai also ὁ <WG3588> ho The [servant] τὰ <WG3588> ta [who had received] the δύο <WG1417> dyo two τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta talents εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie ‘ Master , δύο <WG1417> dyo with two τάλαντά <WG5007> talanta talents . μοι <WG1473> moi me παρέδωκας <WG3860> paredōkas you entrusted ἴδε <WG2400> ide See , ἄλλα <WG243> alla more . ’ δύο <WG1417> dyo two τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta - ἐκέρδησα <WG2770> ekerdēsa I have gained

Ἔφη <WG5346> Ephē replied αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - , ὁ <WG3588> ho - κύριος <WG2962> kyrios master αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His Εὖ <WG2095> Eu ‘ Well done , δοῦλε <WG1401> doule servant ! ἀγαθὲ <WG18> agathe good καὶ <WG2532> kai and πιστέ <WG4103> piste faithful ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi with ὀλίγα <WG3641> oliga a few things ; ἦς <WG1510> ēs You have been πιστός <WG4103> pistos faithful ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi of πολλῶν <WG4183> pollōn many things . σε <WG4771> se you in charge καταστήσω <WG2525> katastēsō I will put εἴσελθε <WG1525> eiselthe Enter εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὴν <WG3588> tēn the χαρὰν <WG5479> charan joy τοῦ <WG3588> tou of κυρίου <WG2962> kyriou master ! ’ σου <WG4771> sou your

Προσελθὼν <WG4334> Proselthōn came δὲ <WG1161> de Finally , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho the [servant] τὸ <WG3588> to the ἓν <WG1520> hen one τάλαντον <WG5007> talanton talent εἰληφὼς <WG2983> eilēphōs who had received εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen said , Κύριε <WG2962> Kyrie ‘ Master , ἔγνων <WG1097> egnōn I knew σε <WG4771> se - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that σκληρὸς <WG4642> sklēros a hard εἶ <WG1510> ei you are ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos man , θερίζων <WG2325> therizōn reaping ὅπου <WG3699> hopou where οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἔσπειρας <WG4687> espeiras you have not sown καὶ <WG2532> kai and συνάγων <WG4863> synagōn gathering ὅθεν <WG3606> hothen where οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv διεσκόρπισας <WG1287> dieskorpisas you have not scattered seed .

καὶ <WG2532> kai So φοβηθεὶς <WG5399> phobētheis I was afraid ἀπελθὼν <WG565> apelthōn and went out [and] ἔκρυψα <WG2928> ekrypsa hid τὸ <WG3588> to - τάλαντόν <WG5007> talanton talent σου <WG4771> sou your ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the γῇ <WG1093> gē ground . ἴδε <WG2400> ide See , ἔχεις <WG2192> echeis you have τὸ <WG3588> to what [belongs] σόν <WG4674> son to you . ’

Ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> Apokritheis replied δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho - κύριος <WG2962> kyrios master . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen . . . αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . Πονηρὲ <WG4190> Ponēre ‘ You wicked , δοῦλε <WG1401> doule servant ! ’ καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὀκνηρέ <WG3636> oknēre lazy ᾔδεις <WG1492> ēdeis ‘ You knew ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that θερίζω <WG2325> therizō I reap ὅπου <WG3699> hopou where οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἔσπειρα <WG4687> espeira I have not sown καὶ <WG2532> kai and συνάγω <WG4863> synagō gather ὅθεν <WG3606> hothen where οὐ <WG3756> ou . . . διεσκόρπισα <WG1287> dieskorpisa I have not scattered seed .

ἔδει <WG1163> edei should σε <WG4771> se you οὖν <WG3767> oun Then βαλεῖν <WG906> balein have deposited τὰ <WG3588> ta - ἀργύριά <WG694> argyria money μου <WG1473> mou my τοῖς <WG3588> tois with the τραπεζίταις <WG5133> trapezitais bankers , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐλθὼν <WG2064> elthōn on my return ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō vvv ἐκομισάμην <WG2865> ekomisamēn I would have received ἂν <WG302> an vvv τὸ <WG3588> to - ἐμὸν <WG1699> emon it back σὺν <WG4862> syn with τόκῳ <WG5110> tokō interest .

Ἄρατε <WG142> Arate take οὖν <WG3767> oun Therefore ἀπ’ <WG575> ap’ from αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou him τὸ <WG3588> to the τάλαντον <WG5007> talanton talent καὶ <WG2532> kai and δότε <WG1325> dote give [it] τῷ <WG3588> tō to the [one] ἔχοντι <WG2192> echonti who has τὰ <WG3588> ta - δέκα <WG1176> deka ten τάλαντα <WG5007> talanta talents .

τῷ <WG3588> tō - γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἔχοντι <WG2192> echonti who has παντὶ <WG3956> panti everyone δοθήσεται <WG1325> dothēsetai will be given [more] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and [he] περισσευθήσεται <WG4052> perisseuthēsetai will have an abundance . τοῦ <WG3588> tou the [one who] δὲ <WG1161> de But μὴ <WG3361> mē does not ἔχοντος <WG2192> echontos have , καὶ <WG2532> kai even ὃ <WG3739> ho what ἔχει <WG2192> echei he has ἀρθήσεται <WG142> arthēsetai will be taken away ἀπ’ <WG575> ap’ from αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou him .

καὶ <WG2532> kai And τὸν <WG3588> ton that ἀχρεῖον <WG888> achreion worthless δοῦλον <WG1401> doulon servant ἐκβάλετε <WG1544> ekbalete throw εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὸ <WG3588> to the σκότος <WG4655> skotos darkness , τὸ <WG3588> to - ἐξώτερον <WG1857> exōteron outer ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei [where] there ἔσται <WG1510> estai will be ὁ <WG3588> ho - κλαυθμὸς <WG2805> klauthmos weeping καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - βρυγμὸς <WG1030> brygmos gnashing τῶν <WG3588> tōn of ὀδόντων <WG3599> odontōn teeth . ’

Ὅταν <WG3752> Hotan When ( The Sheep and the Goats) δὲ <WG1161> de - ἔλθῃ <WG2064> elthē comes ὁ <WG3588> ho the υἱὸς <WG5207> huios Son τοῦ <WG3588> tou - ἀνθρώπου <WG444> anthrōpou of Man ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē - δόξῃ <WG1391> doxē glory , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His καὶ <WG2532> kai and πάντες <WG3956> pantes all οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἄγγελοι <WG32> angeloi angels μετ’ <WG3326> met’ with αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him , τότε <WG5119> tote - καθίσει <WG2523> kathisei He will sit ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi on θρόνου <WG2362> thronou throne . δόξης <WG1391> doxēs glorious αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His
